content:
, 2011
												Pretty much, if you liked FEAR, you'd like FEAR 2. You remember what I said about FEAR? Yeah, it's a lot like that. There's some impressive bits like very gory setpiece events, pretty decent voice-acting and a super-weird ending. The shooting is still very good. The guns still feel powerful especially when in slow-mo, and atmosphere is again very creepy. The combination of horror and manshooter is a little bit more cohesive this time, to the game's benefit.If checkpoint saves really turn you off, or if you don't like the idea of (spoiler) piloting giant robots down corridors, having a shootout on a train, manning a tank cannon while enemies stream out of doorways, or other trope-y sights, stay away!

												Honestly I'm not sure how this game has positive reviews.  When compared to its predessor the game feels...lazy.  It starts off with some of the "spooky" FEAR moments that I love, but they quickly become repetitive and predictable.  The game seems to switch from scary to first person shooter person as if it's sufferering from a bipolar episode.  A couple of plot points are poorly glossed over as well.The shooting mechanics as well felt poor as the game went on.  Bad guys had a lot of armor, and you basically go slowmo, shoot them 5 times in the face and then move on to the next one.  Just felt bad.

1, 2016
General ImpressionsI've originally played the first FEAR on one of my older computers back then and never really finished it because I was too scared. I've also played the rather short-lived Free-To-Play, FEAR Online. Coming over to FEAR 2, there's a lot of things that can be said over game story that show its age compared to most shooters now, but here's a few points that I think needs to be made that stands out from others.What I like about this game:1. This game aesthetically feels like a downgraded Fallout 4; You get plenty of weapons / gear, you get to be in a giant mech and wreck face, there's feral ghouls otherwise known as the replica soldiers. And of course, ragdolls.2. You can literally flip tables.3. You can slow down time. Yes, it's toggleable. 4. You get to see all the horror tropes come before your very eyes.5. Turn off Film Grain and keep on Head Bob to keep things realistic. Turning off Headbob lets you levitate.What I dislike about this game:1. The level design almost feels labyrinthian; if you come back for another session, you'll forget where you have to go2. Lack of Sound. Granted, this is likely for an atmospheric feel, but really drops the immersion from 1st gripe.3. The AI; I can't recall if the original had smarter AI, but these guys literally run at you."You're like a free pizza at an anime convention" - Snakefist

												Pretty decent FPS game with a cinematic feel. A few jump scares in it, nothing that I would really consider "Horror". Still, it was quite enjoyable. Took 9 hours to complete(To be fair though, I did a lot of looking around the levels and just exploring things. Playing straight through prob would have been a lot less time). One thing I should point out though, the game while "Good", is nowhere near as enjoyable as the original FEAR was. So, if you are expecting an equal gaming experience to the original, you might be slightly disappointed.

												This is a really fun game, with an interesting and well-executed mix of FPS and horror. The shooting mechanics are well-done, and each weapon is unique and interesting. The enemies are also unique and varied. The horror element is less 'horror' and more 'suspense'. Nevertheless, I do not view this as a negative. The story draws you in, and the gameplay carries you along - just like any good game should. I have not played the other games in the series, but will likely check those out based on this. Get it on sale for when you need a high-quality filler game.One cavet to all the above: I never managed to finish the game due to a bug that caused half a map to not load in. This does not, however, impact my rating, as I hope it was just a jammy file somewhere. I will likely reinstall and replay the game at a later date, which is something I very, very, rarely do.

												This was one of the games that left a bitter taste in my mouth. After playing the original F.E.A.R., which was an incredible game and ahead of its time, this was a huge letdown. Maybe I'm nostalgic, but I felt that this game took out the best parts of F.E.A.R. and replaced them with jump scares and film grain.Perhaps it is an alright game, but I would never recommend this after seeing the original F.E.A.R. followed by this game.

content:
y 25, 2016
												Fear 2 is a great atmospheric, explosive and HOT sequel to the original Fear.  You return as a sergeant who was a test subject in some clandestine scientific paranormal experiment.  Just like Fear 1 , the gunplay is excellent and the spooky effects are very well implemented into the game.  Basically, everything is an upgrade compared to Fear 1 without losing the roots which make Fear games great.  Alma, the creepy girl returns now as an adult woman haunting you throughout the game. As you progress, she turns from an old hag to a voluptous lady( partially naked cause covered by hair) and to be honest, I begin to look forward to seeing her as I progress further. ( she is kind of HOT) Well, it is seldom that a female ghost falls in love with you in game instead of wanting to rip your soul off!! And the ending, it is mindblowing and should be rated 18+. Haha, anyway if you enjoy a good fps game with some horror elements, this game is definitely worth buying. I do not encounter any bugs beside framerate drops at water areas. Excellent game!!
